page.title: 14Niton & Chale Churches
page.content: There are 4 Christian Churches and a Christian House Fellowship in Niton. The Parish Church (Anglican) is a Saxon foundation and has an interest- ing history.The Registers are the second oldest in the Island and date back to the mid 16th.century.There is an interesting monument in the Church- yard commemorating Edward Edwards,the originator of Public Libraries.There are regular services and an average congregation of 55.For the young there are Family Services and a Tuesday Club.There are regular services at the Methodist,Baptist and Roman Catholic Churches,although there are no resident clergy.There is a monthly United Village Service and a quarterly Ecumenical Newsletter.Chale shares its Rector with Niton.Due to coastal ero- sion,the Church,on the Military Road, is no longer at the Village centre.
